Name of faculty: Science Department: Environmental Science
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 4                       Type: DSC-7
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Subject: Environmental Biotechnology                               NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Credit: 04+02          Total learning hours: 30
Student learning outcome:\r●The major outcome to study the environmental biotechnology is to understand the\rcurrentapplicationsofbiotechnologytoenvironmentalqualityevaluation,\rmonitoring and remediation of contaminated environments.\r●Sustainableenvironmentalbiotechnologyadvancesarehelpingtomake\rmanufacturing processes cleaner and more efficient by reducing toxic chemical\rpollution and greenhouse gas emissions.                               NaN

Unit-1: Introduction and Scope of Environmental Biotechnology(Duration: 07 Hrs)
          1.1 Definition, introduction and scope of environmental biotechnology
                             1.2 Need and issues of environmental biotechnology
                                  1.3 Challenges of Environmental Biotechnology
             1.4 Abatement of pollution and Environmental clean-up technologies
       Unit-2: Introduction and tools for genetic engineering(Duration: 07 Hrs)

.1 DNA modifying enzymes: Nuclease, Alkaline Phosphatase, DNA polymerase,
   Reverse Transcriptase, Polynucleotide Kinase, Methylase and DNA ligase

2.2 Methods of Gene cloning and Gene transformation
2.3 Linkers, adaptors, homopolymer tailing, Site directed mutagenesis

.4 PCR: Process, Methodology and Types, Reverse Transcriptase PCR, Real Time
                                                                         PCR

.1 Cloning vectors: Types and Properties, Essential components of gene cloning
                                    vectors, Selectable and screenable markers

3.2 Plasmids, Bacteriophages, M13 mp vectors, PUC19 and Bluescript vectors
  3.3 Insertion and Replacement Vectors, TA cloning vectors, YACs and BACs
3.4 Expression vectors, plant based vectors, Ti and Ri plasmids as vectors
      Unit-4: Gene library and Genome editing techniques(Duration: 07 Hrs)

.1 Isolation of mRNA and total RNA, reverse transcriptase and cDNA synthesis
                                             .2 Introduction to miRNA and siRNA
                                            .3 Gene knock in and Gene knock out
                                   .4 Genome Editing: CRISPER-CAS, TALENs, ZFNs
.5Applications of genetic engineering techniques in environmental biotechnology

Unit-5: Biomass and Bioenergy(Duration: 07 Hrs)
         5.1 Biomass as a source of energy: Composition and types of biomass
           5.2 Biomass conversion: Thermo-chemical conversion, Bioconversion
                                5.3 Bioenergy – Petroleum plants, Bioethanol
            5.4 Gaseous fuels – Biogas, Biohydrogen and Microbial Fuel cells
                       Unit-6: Bioremediation technologies(Duration: 07 Hrs)
                                  6.1 Bioremediation: Introduction and Types
                                      6.2 Bioaugmentation and Biofilteration
                                          6.3 Bioremediation of hydrocarbons
                                     6.4 Bioremediation of industrial wastes
                 6.5 Bioremediation of recalcitrant and xenobiotic compounds
Unit-7: Phytoremediation and rhizoremediation technologies(Duration :07 Hrs)
                   7.1 Phytoremediation – Introduction, Types and Mechanisms
          7.2 Advantages, Disadvantages and Applications of phytoremediation
                   7.3 Rhizoremediation – Introduction, Types and Mechanisms
                         7.4 Concept of Phytoextraction and rhizofilteration
                                                                         NaN
                                                                         NaN

8.1 Bioleaching: Types, Processes and Examples
            8.2 Bioplastics, Bioscrubbers, Biopesticides and Biofertilizers
8.3Environmental Nanotechnology – Principles and Environmental applications
                            8.4 Biosensors: Types, Working and Applications

1.Isolation of symbotic, nonsymbiotic and anaerobic nitrogen fixing bacteria from
                                                                      rhizosphere
               2.Isolation of genomic DNA from bacterial, yeast and plant samples
                                                       3.Isolation of plasmid DNA
                          4.Study of biosorption of heavy metal by fungal biomass
                                     5.Synthesis of AgNPs by using sodium citrate
                       6.Isolation and enrichment of Uric Acid Utilizing Bacteria
7.Study of seed viability and seed germination assay in presence of environmental
                                                                      pollutants.

Name of Faculty: Science Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       Program: B.Sc. Sem 04               Type: DSC-8
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Subject:Microbial Physiology and Metabolism                       NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Credit: 04 + 02  Total learning hours: 60
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Course description: The objectives of this course are to provide students with the theory and\rpractical experience Physiology and Metabolism aspect of Microorganisms which facilitate\rinvestigation of molecular biology and evolution-related concepts.                       NaN
Student learning outcome:\rAt the end of the course, students will be able to:\r●Understand basics of microbial growth and cell cycle, modes of microbial reproduction.\r●Know the role and effect of various factors- environmental, physical and chemical on\rgrowth of microorganisms and also learn ways and means of cultivating microorganisms in\rin vitro conditions.\r●Explain methods and techniques for controlling microbial growth.\r●Learn about the response of microorganisms towards various stresses to sustain and\rsurvive during exposure to these stresses.\r●At the end of the course, the student has an understanding on the metabolism and\rmechanism of various biomolecules.\r●The student through this course will be able to explain the principle of energy yielding and\rconsuming reactions, various anabolic and catabolic pathways, transport systems and the\rmechanisms of energy conservation in microbial metabolism.                       NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 4             Type: SEC -2
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Subject: Biofertilizer, Biopesticide and Mushroom cultivation                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Credit: 04 + 02 Total learning hours: 60
Course description:\rThis paper covers the Definition, scope and importance of types of biofertilizers.\rBiochemistry of nitrogen fixation and Phosphate solubilization –mechanism and formulation\rof Biofertilizer. Biological control Microbial control, Production of biopesticide based on\rFungi and bacteria.\rPaper is also designed to teach to the students, practical information about wild and cultivated\rmushrooms, cultivation techniques, post - harvest management, pest and disease problems and\rthe economics and marketing strategies which help the students to learn a means of self-\remployment and income generation.                      NaN
                                                                                                                                             Student learning outcome: Upon successful completion of this course students will have\rlearned\rUnderstanding of importance and practical aspects of production of biofertilizers.\rRole of biopesticides/bioinsecticides in the agriculture field.\rNutritional value and commercial use of mushrooms for human consumption.\rPractical cultivation of mushrooms, management of diseases affecting mushrooms,\rmushroom harvesting and various avenues for using it into an entrepreneurship.                      NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department: Allied
                                                        Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 4 Type: DSE-4
                                                              Subject: Nanoscience and Nanotechnology
                                                                  Credit: 02 Total learning hours: 30
             Course description: Nanoscience is the study of structures and molecules on the scale of
  nanometers and the technology which utilizes it in practical applications is called nanotechnology.
          Today, engineers and researchers are finding a wide variety of methods to deliberately make
     nanoscale materials to take the advantages of their enhanced properties such as higher strength,
       lighter weight, high chemical reactivity, etc. also the nanotechnology offers more advances in
  disease treatments, in imaging and diagnostics equipment, in energy efficient products such as fuel
and solar cells, etc. so in order to move towards the advanced materials and devices, students should
                                                                   have the knowledge of nanoscience.
                        Student learning outcome: After learning the course,students should be able :
                                  To understand the difference between bulk and nanoscale materials.
                                                      To understand the basics of nanoscale science.
        To understand the synthesizing technique and difficulties to synthesize the nanomaterials so
                  they can get interest in the search of new composition techniques of nanomaterials.
                           To understand the various applications of nanoscience and nanotechnology.
